Posts.Content: jenn24 wrote: Hello Ladies! I had a stereotactic biospy of a new cluster of pleomorphic calcifications today. I was super nervous about the procedure because the one I had 4 years ago was not a good experience at all. I'm happy to say that today's biopsy was much better! Of course that may be because I opted for Valium this time! :) Like I know a lot of you are, I am now waiting, 5 to 7 days, for the results to come back. I'm scheduled to meet with my BS next Thursday to discuss the results but they will call me if they come in before that day. Ugh, the waiting. I know you all understand what I'm talking about I just felt to need to vent! If only I could just fast forward to next Thursday! Dx 3/5/2011, DCIS, Stage 0 Surgery 5/8/2011 Lumpectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/14/2011 Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sterotactic Biopsy Today, and the wait begins jenn24 jenn24

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2015 10:12PM jenn24 wrote: Thanks ladies! I absolutely plan on my husband driving me home. Last time I drive myself home and had to pull over because I was so upset after the biopsy. I appreciate the encouraging words.

Posts.Content: jenn24 wrote: Hello ladies! I am having a stereotactic biopsy on Thursday. I had one 4 years ago and it was very unpleasant to say the least. This time my doctor has prescribed me Valium to take before the procedure. Have any of you taken Valium prior to the biopsy and did it help? My nerves are already shot between worrying about the pending results and my fear of the procedure itself. She gave me three pills, maybe I should just take one now!
